oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE RECONSTRUCTION OF THE NETHERLAND DIKES AFTER THE STORM OF FEBRUARY 1953
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schijf, J. B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Netherlands
breaching
storm damage
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The reconstruction of the damage to the dikes by the flood of February 1953 presented an enormous task. From the hydraulic engineer's point of view the most interesting part was the closing of the major or tidal breaches, that is to say, the places where a dike for a certain length was totally destroyed and where, therefore, the tides had free entrance to the inundated interior, scouring out deep gullies. This called into action the resources of tidal hydraulics, theoretical considerations, and model experiments.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 4 (1953): Proceedings of 4th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Chicago, Illinois, 1953.; 19
